string.name: rp_list_custom
string.comment: Recurrence in the list of preset

string.name: rp_picker_done
string.comment: Text of button to confirm the recurrence view.

item.comment: Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.
Used in a list of days of week.

plurals.name: rp_format_day
plurals.comment: Text for a daily recurrence. The number argument is the frequency. The | character is required to separate the part the goes before the number and the part that goes after for user input labels, but it is never shown.

plurals.name: rp_format_week
plurals.comment: Text for a weekly recurrence. The number argument is the frequency. The | character is required to separate the part the goes before the number and the part that goes after for user input labels, but it is never shown.

plurals.name: rp_format_month
plurals.comment: Text for a monthly recurrence. The number argument is the frequency. The | character is required to separate the part the goes before the number and the part that goes after for user input labels, but it is never shown.

plurals.name: rp_format_year
plurals.comment: Text for a yearly recurrence. The number argument is the frequency. The | character is required to separate the part the goes before the number and the part that goes after for user input labels, but it is never shown.

string.name: rp_format_weekly_option
string.comment: The string argument is replaced with a list of days of week.

string.name: rp_format_weekly_all
string.comment: Used for a weekly recurrence that happens on every day of the week instead of a list of days.

string.name: rp_format_monthly_same_day
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of each month

resources.string: on the same day each month

string.name: rp_format_monthly_last_day
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the last day of each month

resources.string: on the last day of the month

string.name: rp_format_monthly_sun
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_mon
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_tue
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_wed
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_thu
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_fri
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

string.name: rp_format_monthly_sat
string.comment: Used for a monthly recurrence that happens on the same day of the same week of each month. String argument is replaced by an ordinal number eg: 'third'

item.comment: Used with strings rp_format_monthly_*. Use correct case and plural.
Used with strings rp_format_monthly_*. Use correct case and plural.
Used with strings rp_format_monthly_*. Use correct case and plural.
Used with strings rp_format_monthly_*. Use correct case and plural.
Used with strings rp_format_monthly_*. Use correct case and plural.

string.name: rp_format_end_date
string.comment: Goes after a recurrence that ends on a date. The string argument specifies this date.

plurals.name: rp_format_end_count
plurals.comment: Goes after a recurrence that ends after a number of events. The number argument specifies this number.
